Questions.q: 1.In a closely compacted mass, individual parenchyma cells average ______ faces. a) 6 b) 14 c) 18
2.Collenchyma cells with thickened walls adjacent to intercellular spaces is termed as a) angular b) annular c) lacunar
3.A feature associated with parenchyma cells: a) small or no vacuoles b) a highly elongated cellular axis c) totipotency
4.Closed vascular bundles are found in: a) gymnosperms b) dicots c) monocots
5.A bicollateral vascular bundle: a) has phloem on both sides of the xylem b) has xylem on both sides of the phloem c) is represented by the fusion of two vascular bundles
Questions.a: a) has phloem on both sides of the xylem.
Questions.q: 6.Cell walls of collenchyma cells are flexible due to : a) their elastic nature due to contractile proteins b) irregular secondary thickenings c) a helicoidal arrangement of cellulose microfibrils
Questions.a: c) a helicoidal arrangement of cellulose microfibrils.
Questions.q: 7.Why safranin stain is used as counter stain?
Questions.a: Safranin is used as a counterstain in some staining protocols,since it colours all cell nuclei red
